data.title: Authentic
data.text: My girlfriend and I were staying in Frederick for the evening, as we planned on doing some hiking and visiting some of the historic sites in the area the following day.  We arrived at our hotel and wanted to grab dinner, but nothing chain affiliated.  Luckily, we found Sabor de Cuba on trip advisor and made an online reservation for 730.  It was a busy Friday night, but luckily I found parking right out front and was welcomed into the cozy establishment.  My girlfriend, who is Cuban, was skeptical, but the moment her Sopa de Pollo came out, she knew it was authentic.  I had the Vaca Frita, which was slightly dry, but extremely flavorful and, along with the rice and beans, gave it the perfect taste.  The beans were the best I've ever had anywhere, no hyperbole.  The waitress was very helpful and attended to us with enthusiasm.  Can't recommend this place enough.

data.title: Great flavors, but some flaws
data.text: Four of us ate here on a Wednesday night.  The place wasn't that busy, but they seemed understaffed.  Trillian and I arrived after our friends, who already had their drinks.  It took quite a few minutes for the bartender/waiter to visit the table for our drink orders.  I will say that he was quite helpful in answering our questions about the food. I had and absolutely great mojito, and she had a well-made margarita.  We did not note the amount of time it took for our dishes to come, but it seemed inordinately long.  I had the Ropa Vieja - pulled flank steak.  It was very real tasty, but very tough.  The side of congri, a mixture of rice and black beans was absolutely delicious, as were the sweet carmelized plantains served on top.  Trillian had Arroz con Pollo, one of her favorite dishes.  She really liked the chicken, however, the rice was gummy.  Our friends had the Seafood Paella, and seemed to enjoy it very much.

data.title: Good Cuban stop in Frederick
data.text:
This is authentic cuban food and dont get me wrong, it is good cuban food.  But, if you are a connoissuer of cuban food and try to get it whenever you can, this may not be your version of cuban food.  It is Frederick-ized, and I get it.

Nevertheless, the people are friendly and the restaurant is clean and the meals are hearty.  You wont leave hungry.  The desserts look amazing ... unfortunately I could not partake, but if I ever return to Frederick, I will remember them. :)

data.title: Wonderful food with great service
data.text: We split our meal. Started with empanadas, split Avocado salad and split a grilled snapper main course. The portions are big.

data.title: Great Cuban flavors!
data.text: We visit Frederick several times a year and often lunch here. I love their chicken soup/stew! Daughter likes the "Cuban" sodas.

data.title: Nice place in downtown Frederick
data.text: This place has been consistently good for us, both the service and the food.  Only one time I had a problem with a dish, where the kitchen seemed to have drop a lot of salt (was not really edible and I left most of it).  The rest of the visits, we've not been disappointed.  The menu is not very extensive, but the prices are good, which turns into a good value.

data.title: Somewhat good, somewhat disappointing
data.text: Vegetarian plate was ok, empanadas also good, but with a caveat. The pork was not bad but it was awfully hard to chew, and later to digest. Perhaps it was only that pieces. Let's hope so. Tres leche was ok,

data.title: Great food and Great host/owner.
data.text: I enjoyed the meal very much.  The food is based upon handed down recipes from the owners Grandmother.  The owner is very welcoming.  I would go back without hesitation.

data.title: Paella to die for
data.text: Have only been here twice and the first time made me come back because of the paella.  Enough for two with a little left over.  My friend had the Cuban sandwich and said it was very good.

data.title: ¡Comidas típicas!
data.text:
Wasn't planning to stop, but one of the kids was hungry while out shopping. The kid had sandwich de pollo (he thought it was excellent).  I had the tostones and maduros.  I usually judge Latin food on how well they fix these two staples, and they didn't disappoint.  I would've liked to have tried the yuca frita too, but was too full. I'll definitely go back to sample a few more dishes. 

We were there between the lunch and dinner rush, and the service was attentive and quick.

data.title: Authentic Cuban in the Heart of Frederick
data.text: The secret to Sabor is that the owner uses his grandmother's recipes to provide an authentic taste of Cuba.  Outside of Miami, this is the best Cuban food I have had.  The entrees are all fabulous, but be sure to save some room for Café Cubano and a flan to share.  It is an all around wonderful experience.

data.title: Great Meats and Friendly Smiles
data.text: Excellent customer service.  The boiled yuca appetizer was fresh but a little bland.  The shrimp entree was fresh and creamy with steamed rice and refreshing garnishment.  The flank steak was well seasoned and a marvelous chew.  Great dessert to top it off.  I can't wait to visit this place again.

data.title: Fantastic Meal in the Heart of Frederick!
data.text: Sabor de Cuba is a hidden gem in Frederick. The service is great, the food is delicious, and the atmosphere is fun!!! My husband and I went here on a date night on a random Saturday evening and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. We tried the specialty cocktails (spicy margarita and a fruit mojito) and thought they were great! We also tried the chef's special for the night, which was a shrimp, ginger, and rice meal. The meal was out of this world and absolutely delicious. We cannot wait to return soon!!

data.title: Best dessert in Frederick
data.text: The coconut flan is to die for!!!  The service is a little slow, but cafe con leche and coconut flan is worth the wait!!

data.title: Yummy dinner... maduros was great unexpectedly
data.text: I was working late one day so I decided to have dinner at this place since it's near the office. I ordered a normal steak with rice dinner. It came out with maduros on top. I did not like it (it was a thought) so I put it aside and finished my dinner. The steak and rice were great, tasty and smell very good. After that, I took a bite of the maduros out of curiosity more than anything, it was very good so I ended up finishing the maduros too. The service was fast and the waiter/waitress was friendly and helpful. I just ordered a maduros to go today for my wife... it's very yummy.

data.title: Authentic
data.text: Well prepared cuisine with authentic flavors. The service was excellent. My only complaint was how loud it was. A bit difficult to have a conversation.

data.title: Lovely Casual Dining
data.text:
My husband and I took visiting friends here for dinner. Looking at the other diners' plates, we ladies concluded that the portions were huge! We therefore ordered two appetizers each and the gents each ordered entrees.

The sizzling shrimp appetizer is spectacular.

Our friends are conducting a nation-wide search for the best mojito and took this opportunity for more research. On a scale of 1-10, where 1 is "meh" and 10 is superb, they judged their mojitos to be 9.5.

We could not face dessert. We shall have to return.

data.title: Good service, really good Cuban food
data.text: Went there for Sunday afternoon lunch, so business was constant, but not crowded or noisy. The pernil was a fabulous, tasty pork dish that was both crispy and tender, served with plantains that you can order either savory or sweet. Even the rice was flavorful. The special was camarónes con crema (shrimp with cream), which was also served with plantains and rice. WOW! so good. Service was also quite good - attentive, but not smothering. All in all, well worth the price, which was a little over $40, before tax and tips (no drinks).

data.title: Tasty
data.text: Very tasty and delicious, quality food.  The portions are large and fulfilling.  The service was quick and attentive.  The only reason it's not a 5 out of 5 for me is because of the humidity in the restaurant itself.  It lacks a/c and they have small fans throughout the restaurant but still not enough to cool you down from the heat outside.

data.title: Great Cuban food!
data.text: Went for lunch with DH. Great monitors and empanadas. Good entrees for both of us! Big portion sizes so didn't try dessert. We'll be back!
